verses.verse: Howbeit <S%H199><s%>, Job <S%H347><s%>, I pray thee <S%H8085><s%>, hear my speech <S%H4405><s%>, And hearken <S%H238><s%> to all my words <S%H1697><s%>.
Behold now <S%H6605><s%>, I have opened my mouth <S%H6310><s%>; My tongue <S%H3956><s%> hath spoken <S%H1696><s%> in my mouth <S%H2441><s%>.

My words <S%H561><s%> shall utter the uprightness <S%H3476><s%> of my heart <S%H3820><s%>; And that which my lips <S%H8193><s%> know <S%H1847><s%> they shall speak <S%H4448><s%> sincerely <S%H1305><s%>.
The Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of God <S%H410><s%> hath made <S%H6213><s%> me <S%H5397><s%>, And the breath of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> giveth me life <S%H2421><s%>.
If thou canst <S%H3201><s%>, answer <S%H7725><s%> thou me <S%H6186><s%>; Set thy words in order before <S%H6440><s%> me <S%H3320><s%>, stand forth.
Behold <S%H410><s%>, I am toward God even as thou art <S%H6310><s%>: I also am formed <S%H7169><s%> out of the clay <S%H2563><s%>.
Behold <S%H367><s%>, my terror shall not make thee afraid <S%H1204><s%>, Neither shall my pressure <S%H405><s%> be heavy upon thee <S%H3513><s%>.
Surely thou hast spoken <S%H559><s%> in my hearing <S%H241><s%>, And I have heard <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of thy words <S%H4405><s%>, saying,
I am clean <S%H2134><s%>, without transgression <S%H6588><s%>; I am innocent <S%H2643><s%>, neither is there iniquity in me <S%H5771><s%>:
Behold <S%H4672><s%>, he findeth occasions <S%H8569><s%> against me <S%H2803><s%>, He counteth me for his enemy <S%H341><s%>:
He putteth <S%H7760><s%> my feet <S%H7272><s%> in the stocks <S%H5465><s%>, He marketh <S%H8104><s%> all my paths <S%H734><s%>.
Behold <S%H6030><s%>, I will answer thee <S%H6663><s%>, in this thou art not just; For God <S%H433><s%> is greater <S%H7235><s%> than man <S%H582><s%>.
Why dost thou strive <S%H7378><s%> against him <S%H6030><s%>, For that he giveth not account of any of his matters <S%H1697><s%>?
For God <S%H410><s%> speaketh <S%H1696><s%> once <S%H259><s%>, Yea twice <S%H8147><s%>, though man regardeth it not <S%H7789><s%>.

In a dream <S%H2472><s%>, in a vision <S%H2384><s%> of the night <S%H3915><s%>, When deep <S%H8639><s%> sleep falleth <S%H5307><s%> upon men <S%H582><s%>, In slumberings <S%H8572><s%> upon the bed <S%H4904><s%>;
Then he openeth <S%H1540><s%> the ears <S%H241><s%> of men <S%H582><s%>, And sealeth <S%H2856><s%> their instruction <S%H4561><s%>,
That he may withdraw <S%H5493><s%> man <S%H120><s%> from his purpose <S%H4639><s%>, And hide <S%H3680><s%> pride <S%H1466><s%> from man <S%H1397><s%>;
He keepeth back <S%H2820><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from the pit <S%H7845><s%>, And his life <S%H2416><s%> from perishing <S%H5674><s%> by the sword <S%H7973><s%>.
He is chastened <S%H3198><s%> also with pain <S%H4341><s%> upon his bed <S%H4904><s%>, And with continual <S%H7230><s%> strife <S%H386><s%> in his bones <S%H6106><s%>;
So that his life <S%H2416><s%> abhorreth <S%H2092><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>, And his soul <S%H5315><s%> dainty <S%H8378><s%> food <S%H3978><s%>.
His flesh <S%H1320><s%> is consumed away <S%H3615><s%>, that it cannot be seen <S%H7210><s%>; And his bones <S%H6106><s%> that were not seen <S%H7200><s%> stick out <S%H8192><s%>.
Yea <S%H5315><s%>, his soul draweth near <S%H7126><s%> unto the pit <S%H7845><s%>, And his life <S%H2416><s%> to the destroyers <S%H4191><s%>.

If there <S%H3426><s%> be with him an angel <S%H4397><s%>, An interpreter <S%H3887><s%>, one <S%H259><s%> among a thousand <S%H505><s%>, To show <S%H5046><s%> unto man <S%H120><s%> what is right for him <S%H3476><s%>;

Then God is gracious <S%H2603><s%> unto him <S%H559><s%>, and saith, Deliver <S%H6308><s%> him from going down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit <S%H7845><s%>, I have found <S%H4672><s%> a ransom <S%H3724><s%>.
His flesh <S%H1320><s%> shall be fresher <S%H7375><s%> than a child <S%H5290><s%>'s; He returneth <S%H7725><s%> to the days <S%H3117><s%> of his youth <S%H5934><s%>.

He prayeth <S%H6279><s%> unto God <S%H433><s%>, and he is favorable <S%H7521><s%> unto him <S%H7200><s%>, So that he seeth his face <S%H6440><s%> with joy <S%H8643><s%>: And he restoreth <S%H7725><s%> unto man <S%H582><s%> his righteousness <S%H6666><s%>.

He singeth <S%H7789><s%> before men <S%H582><s%>, and saith <S%H559><s%>, I have sinned <S%H2398><s%>, and perverted <S%H5753><s%> that which was right <S%H3477><s%>, And it profited me not <S%H7737><s%>:
He hath redeemed <S%H6299><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> from going <S%H5674><s%> into the pit <S%H7845><s%>, And my life <S%H2416><s%> shall behold <S%H7200><s%> the light <S%H216><s%>.
Lo <S%H410><s%>, all these things doth God work <S%H6466><s%>, Twice <S%H6471><s%>, yea thrice, with a man <S%H1397><s%>,
To bring back <S%H7725><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from the pit <S%H7845><s%>, That he may be enlightened <S%H215><s%> with the light <S%H216><s%> of the living <S%H2416><s%>.
Mark well <S%H7181><s%>, O Job <S%H347><s%>, hearken <S%H8085><s%> unto me <S%H2790><s%>: Hold thy peace, and I will speak <S%H1696><s%>.
If thou hast <S%H3426><s%> anything to say <S%H4405><s%>, answer <S%H7725><s%> me <S%H4405><s%>: Speak, for I desire <S%H2654><s%> to justify thee <S%H6663><s%>.
If not <S%H8085><s%>, hearken thou unto me <S%H2790><s%>: Hold thy peace, and I will teach <S%H502><s%> thee wisdom <S%H2451><s%>.
